purpose: Outline actions for racial justice and equity
title: Our commitment to racial justice and equity

bullets.text: and hiring of Black colleagues in our firm over the next four years
in an anti-racism and inclusion program in addition to our existing training on unconscious bias. We will make these materials available publicly for others to use in their own organizations

bullets.highlight: Create a firmwide day of service
bullets.text: dedicated to understanding racial injustice and giving back to our communities. On that day, we will recognize those who exemplify anti-racism and inclusion

bullets.highlight: Bring to bear the best available expertise
bullets.text: to help us ensure our processes are free from bias and to support the attraction, development, advancement and retention of Black and diverse colleagues

bullets.highlight: Create a dedicated McKinsey Academy virtual leadership program
bullets.text: and make it available at no cost to our clients to support rising Black executives. We will also broaden and expand our student internship programs across our firm to help grow more Black leaders

bullets.highlight: Building upon the McKinsey Global Institute
bullets.text: and our related longstanding research on racial inequities, we will found a Black economic institute to translate insights into practical tools to enable our clients to advance Black economic empowerment and racial equity in the U.S. and beyond

bullets.highlight: Double our spending with diverse suppliers
Contribute $2 million in cash to Generation
bullets.text: to launch new programs in the U.S. to train and place Black learners in small and medium-sized Black-owned businesses. Globally, we will double our support for Generation to train and place 40,000 learners in 14 countries, predominantly from under-represented groups

bullets.highlight: Commit $200 million over the next 10 years in pro bono work globally
bullets.text: to advance racial equity and economic empowerment among Black communities

bullets.highlight: Donate a total of $5 million in cash this year
bullets.text: to nonprofits working to create educational opportunities and combat racism. The majority of this gift will be directed to organizations to be selected by our McKinsey Black Network colleagues
